altIdentifier.collection: William Wright, Catalogue of the Syriac Manuscripts in the British Museum Acquired since the Year 1838
William Wright, Catalogue of the Syriac Manuscripts in the British Museum Acquired since the Year 1838

head.note: This manuscript contains: Severus of Antioch. The sixth book of the select epistles of Severus of Antioch; . In total, including sub-sections, this manuscript contains 50 items.

msItem.title: The sixth book of the select epistles of Severus of Antioch
msItem.note: In the same translation as Add. 12,181 .
The Index of the eleven τίτλοι, or heads, under which the epistles are arranged, is lost.

msItem.title: First Section
To the bishop Constantine.
To Solon, bishop and metropolitan of Seleucia in Isauria
To the same (Solon, bishop and metropolitan of Seleucia in Isauria)
To the same (Solon, bishop and metropolitan of Seleucia in Isauria).
To Peter, bishop of Apamea.
To the bishop Nicias.
To Castor, bishop of Perge.
To the dux Timostratus.
To Stephen, bishop of Tripolis.
To the bishop Eucharius.
To the abbat of the convent of Bassus.
To the priests Cosmas, Polyeuctus and Zeno.
To Entrechius, bishop of Anazarbus.
To Antonine, bishop of Aleppo.
To the same (Antonine, bishop of Aleppo).
To the same (Antonine, bishop of Aleppo).
To the chamberlain Mishael.
To Entrechius, bishop of Anazarbus.
To Solon, bishop of Seleucia in Isauria.
Letter, in the name of the synod (of Antioch), to the bishops under the jurisdiction of (Peter,) the metropolitan of Apamea.
To a Magister.
To the Fathers.
To Solon, bishop of Seleucia in Isauria.
To Theotecnus the archiater.
To Dionysius, bishop of Tarsus.
To Solon, bishop of Seleucia in Isauria.
To Musonius and Alexander, vindices of Anazarbus.
To Philoxenus, bishop of Doliche.
To the monks of the convent of Mār Isaac.
To the clergy of Apamea.
Commonitorium to the bishops of Phoenicia.
To John, bishop of Alexandria the less (Alexandretta or Scandarūn).
To Dionysius, bishop of Tarsus.
To the bishops under the metropolitan of Apamea.
To the priest Eustathius.
To the deacon Eusebius of Apamea.
To Simeon, bishop of Ḳinnesrīn.
To the same (Simeon, bishop of Ḳinnesrīn).
To the clergy and magistracy of Apamea.
To the general Hypatius.
To Solon, bishop of Seleucia in Isauria.
To the Fathers.
To the abbat of the convent of Mār Simeon.
To Eutychianus, magistrate of Apamea.
To Conon, the chief officer of police.
To the priests and abbats John and John, and others
To the priest Philip
The latter portion of a letter.
To the priest Theodore, abbat of the convent of Romanus

To the deacon Mishael

Marginܡܢ ܗ̇ܢܘܢ ܕܒܬܪ ܪܕܘܦܝܐ ܡܢ ܟܬܒܐ ܕ܏ܛ ܗ̇ܝ ܕܡ܏ܓ

msItem.title: Second section
To the Patricians
To the priests John and John
To the orthodox laity of Emesa
Third section
To the Comes Anastasius, the son of Sergius.
To Ammianus and Epagathus
To the deacon Mishael
To the patrician lady Cæsaria

msItem.note: Here (after fol. 84), three quires are wanting, which contained the whole of the fourth section and part of the fifth.

msItem.title: Fifth section
Part 6
To Dionysius, bishop of Tarsus

msItem.title: Sixth section: that we should make no account of the excommunications or separations pronounced by heretics
msItem.rubric: ܛܝܛܠܘܣ ܕܫܬܐ܀ ܕܠܐ ܙܕܩ̇ ܕܢܥܒܕ ܐܢܫ ܡܠܬܐ ܕܚ̣ܪ̈ܡܐ ܐܘ ܦܪ̈ܘܫܝܐ̇. ܐܝܠܝܢ ܕܗ̇ܘܝܢ ܡܢ ܗܪ̈ܛܝܩܘ

msItem.title: To the pious lady Isidora
msItem.rubric: ܠܘܬ ܐܝܣܝܕܘܪܐ (ⲒⲤⲒⲆⲰⲢⲀ) ܪܚ̇ܡܬ ܠܡܫܝܚܐ
Marginܡܢ ܗܠܝܢ ܕܒܬܪ ܪܕܘܦܝܐ ܡܢ ܟܬܒܐ ܕ܏ܛ ܗ̇ܝ ܕ܏ܝܓ

msItem.title: Eighth section: concerning these who mutilate themselves, or are mutilated by violence; and concerning these who have slain themselves in the hour of martyrdom; and that it is the custom in many churches to read the acts and praises of the saints
msItem.rubric: ܛܝܛܠܘܣ ܕܬܡܢܝܐ܀ ܡܛܠ ܗ̇ܢܘܢ ܕܦܣ̇ܩܝܢ ܗܕܡ̈ܐ ܕܝܠܗܘܢ ܡܘ̈ܠܕܢܐ̣. ܘܡܛܠ ܗ̇ܢܘܢ ܕܡܢ ܐܘܠܨܢܐ ܡܬ݁ܦܣܩܝ̣ܢ. ܘܡܛܠ ܗ̇ܢܘܢ ܕܗ̣̇ܢܘܢ ܠܗܘܢ ܩܛܠ̣ܘ ܒܙܒܢܐ ܕܣܗܕܘܬܐ̇. ܘܕܥܝܕܐ ܗܘ ܒܥܕ̈ܬܐ ܣܓܝܐ̈ܬܐ̇. ܕܢܬܩܪܘܢ ܢܨ̈ܚܢܐ ܘܩܘܠܣ̈ܐ ܕܩ̈ܕܝܫܐ.܀

msItem.title: To the reader Stephen
msItem.rubric: ܠܘܬ ܣܛܦܐܢܘܣ ܩܪܘܝܐ
Marginܡܢ ܗܠܝܢ ܕܒܐܦܝܣܩܦܘܬܐ ܡܢ ܟܬܒܐ ܏ܕܙ ܗ̇ܝ ܕ܏ܫܨܒ

msItem.rubric: ܠܘܬ ܩܐܣܝܢܘܣ ܐܦܝܣܩܦܐ ܕܒܘܣܛܪܐ
Marginܡܢ ܗܠܝܢ ܕܒܦܝܣܩܦܘܬܐ ܡܢ ܟܬܒܐ ܏ܕܙ ܗ̇ܝ ܏ܕܫܥܒ

msItem.title: To the advocate Aurelius
msItem.rubric: ܠܘܬ ܐܘܪܝܠܝܣ ܣܟܠܣܛܝܩܐ
Marginܡܢ ܗܠܝܢ ܕܒܐܦܝܣܩܦܘܬܐ ܡܢ ܟܬܒܐ ܏ܕܙ ܗ̇ܝ ܕ܏ܫܥܘ ܏ܫܥܚ

msItem.title: To the advocate John of Bostra
msItem.rubric: ܠܘܬ ܝܘܚܢܢ ܣܟܘܠܣܛܝܩܐ ܒܘܣܛܪܝܐ
Marginܡܢ ܗܠܝܢ ܕܒܬܪ ܪܕܘܦܝܐ ܡܢ ܟܬܒܐ ܕ܏ܗ ܗ̇ܝ ܕ܏ܠܛ

msItem.rubric: ܠܘܬ ܐܢܕܪܐܐ ܩܪܘܝܐ ܘܢܘܛ̇ܪܐ
Marginܡܢ ܗܠܝܢ ܕܒܬܪ ܪܕܘܦܝܐ ܡܢ ܟܬܒܐ ܕ܏ܛ ܗ̇ܝ ܕܣ܏ܐ ܕ܏ܢܐ

msItem.title: Ninth section : concerning baptisms performed by deacons or laymen in time of persecution; and concerning those who are in doubt whether they are (duly) baptized or not
msItem.rubric: ܛܝܛܠܘܣ ܕܬܫܥܐ܀ ܡܛܠ ܡ̈ܥܡܘܕܝܬܐ ܐܝܠܝܢ ܕܗܘ̈ܝܢ ܒܙܒܢܐ ܕܐܘܠܨܢܐ ܡܢ ܡܫܡ̈ܫܢܐ ܐܘ ܡܢ ܥܠܡ̈ܝܐ̣. ܘܡܛܠ ܐܝܠܝܢ ܕܡܬ̇ܦܫܟܝܢ ܐܢ ܥܡ̣ܕܘ ܐܘ ܠܐ

msItem.title: To the Fathers (the deacons ܐܢܝܐ [Onias?] and Zacharias, and the monk Elias)
msItem.rubric: ܠܘܬ ܐܒܗ̈ܬܐ
Marginܡܢ ܗܠܝܢ ܕܒܐܦܝܣܩܦܘܬܐ ܡܢ ܟܬܒܐ ܏ܕܘ ܗ̇ܝ ܕ܏ܪ

msItem.title: To Theodore, bishop of Olbe
msItem.rubric: ܠܘܬ ܬܐܘܕܘܪܘܣ ܐܦܝܣܩܦܐ ܕܐܘܠܒܝ (ⲞⲖⲂⲎ)
Marginܡܢ ܗܠܝܢ ܕܒܐܦܝܣܦܘܬܐ ܡܢ ܟܬܒܐ ܏ܕܛ ܗ̇ܝ ܏ܕܚ

msItem.title: To the countess (κομήτισσα) Thecla
msItem.rubric: ܠܘܬ ܬܩܠܐ ܩܘܡܝܛܝܣܐ
Marginܡܢ ܗܠܝܢ ܕܒܬܪ ܪܕܘܦܝܐ ܡܢ ܟܬܒܐ ܕ܏ܓ. ܗ̇ܝ ܕ܏ܢܓ

msItem.title: Tenth section: concerning a man who has a wife and children, and wishes to become a monk; and concerning women and marriage

msItem.rubric: ܠܘܬ ܓܐܘܪܓܝܐ ܒܪܬܗ̇ ܕܐܢܣܛܣܝܐ ܗܘܦܛܝܣܐ

msItem.title: Unidentified contents
msItem.note: The four unconnected leaves, foll. 145-148, should, not improbably, find their place in the great lacuna between foll. 84 and 85.

physDesc.p: Vellum, about 11 in. by 7 3/8, consisting of 148 leaves, some of which are much stained and torn, especially foll. 1—3, 52, 53, 144, 146 and 147. The quires, signed with letters, were originally at least 22 in number, but ܐ, ܝܓ, ܝܕ and ܝܗ are lost, and, ܒ, ܙ, ܚ, ܛ and ܝ are very imperfect. Leaves are wanting both at the beginning and end, as well as after foll. 1, 53, 55, 57, 63, 84, 144, 145, 146 and 147. Each page is divided into two columns, of from 27 to 40 lines.

handDesc.handNote: This volume is written in a good, regular Estrangela of the viiith cent.

additions.note: N.B., folio location may not be available for some items below.

item.p: Many Greek proper names and other words are expressed on the margins in Greek letters

recordHist.source: Manuscript description based on Wright's Catalogue . abbreviated by the Syriaca.org editors.

bibl.author: William Wright
bibl.title: Catalogue of Syriac Manuscripts in the British Museum Acquired since the Year 1838

interpretation.p: Description is based on Wright's Catalogue without consultation of physical manuscripts. Foliation is approximate. Wright often does not indicate ending folia so those have been assumed based on beginning folia.
Scribal notes which could not be more clearly classified based on Wright's descriptions have been identified as <addition>s whether they occur in the margins or the body of the manuscript.
In general, we have classified as an <msItem> as much of the manuscript contents as possible, including tables of contents and indices.

category.catDesc: Catenae Patrum and Demonstrations against Heresies
Councils of the Church and Ecclesiastical Canons
